settings.heading: Transform your sports experience
settings.description: Seamlessly connect with the UTR Sports Engage API and bring more level-based play to your pickleball and tennis players!
Easily connect players' accounts and sync their UTR Ratings and UTR Pickleball Ratings to their profiles.
Utilizing Engage API underscores your commitment to provide unparalleled value to your users
Players easily enjoy better quality rating information on their opponents and past match activity.
Players can easily track their progress and growth as they work to improve their UTR Rating and UTR-P Rating.

settings.heading: New ways to connect with UTR Sports
Ready to  get started?
settings.row_content:
1. Complete the developer application.
  2. UTR Sports responds to you within 7 working days. Approved partners receive access info with highly-restricted rate limits in place.
  3. Reply to the API developer team with your integration, and you're off!

Additional key links

  • API documentation
  • API brand guidelines
  • API terms and conditions

settings.row_content:
Benefits of a Engage API Partnerships:

settings.heading: What does the Engage API do?
settings.row_content:
The Engage API allows cross-platform users (aka users from third-party sites who are also UTR Sports members) to connect their accounts. Once their accounts are connected, third-party sites can hit endpoints hosted within our Engage API service to retrieve player ratings and extended player profile information, as well as post unverified & verified results. Check our Swagger docs for the most up-to-date information on available endpoints - you can sign in with an empty username & password.

Click here to view the complete UTR Sports Engage API Documentation.

settings.heading: What are the prerequisites to utilize UTR Sports Engage API oAuth flow?
settings.row_content:
To utilize the UTR Sports OAuth flow, you will need the following:

  • Client ID (provided by UTR Sports)
  • Client Secret (provided by UTR Sports)
  • Redirect URI (created by the client and communicated to UTR Sports)

Note that, in addition to a production redirect URI, you may provide us with a development/testing version of your redirect URI that we can whitelist.

Click here to view complete UTR Sports Engage API documentation.

settings.heading: Where can I find the Engage API Brand Guidelines?
settings.row_content: Click here to view the Engage API Brand Guidelines.

settings.heading: Where can I find the UTR Sports API Developer Application?
settings.row_content: Click here to view and complete the UTR Sports API Developer Application.

settings.heading: How do I choose which type of rating to show?
settings.row_content:
UTR Sports has three different types of ratings: Estimated Ratings, Unverified Ratings, and Verified Ratings.

After players create their UTR Sports profiles, players without match results logged will receive an Estimated UTR Pickleball Rating (P1-P5) or an Estimated UTR Rating, both based on questionnaire answers. With enough matches, these ratings convert to numerical ratings.

The Unverified Rating reflects results from a broader range of event types, including casual play, verified matches, and practice matches. Every result can count towards players' Unverified Ratings, for both the Unverified UTR-P Rating and Unverified UTR Rating.

The Verified Rating, for both UTR-P and UTR Rating, reflects results from only verified third-party event providers and tournament directors.

The Verified Rating is the most accurate rating available from UTR Sports. When deciding which rating to display in your app, UTR Sports recommends choosing the Verified Rating (if available), followed by Unverified, followed by Estimated. But the best rating to display is ultimately up to the needs of your product.

settings.heading: Which decimals are visible for UTR and UTR-P ratings within the API?
settings.row_content:
Engage API seamlessly integrates UTR and UTR-P ratings, giving your players access to take their ratings with them wherever they play and track their performance. The behavior breakdown is based on their UTR Sports Power subscription status and sport.

For the UTR Rating (tennis)

Power Users will see:

  • 2 decimal ratings for all players in the UTR Sports app
  • 2 decimal ratings for themselves and other Power users on your platform
  • Integer ratings for other free users on your platform

Free Users will see:

  • 2 decimal ratings for themselves in the UTR Sports app
  • Integer ratings for all other players in the UTR Sports app
  • 2 decimal ratings for Power users on your platform
  • Integer ratings for themselves and other free users on your platform

For the UTR-P Rating (pickleball), which only has one decimal, integer ratings will be visible to all users across the UTR Sports app and on your platform.

settings.heading: How often can I sync ratings?
settings.row_content: How often you sync ratings is ultimately up to the needs of your application. UTR Sports' ratings update daily, so there's no need to sync more frequently than once every 24 hours.

settings.heading: Can I sync ratings for anyone on the platform?
settings.row_content:
Yes and no. In order to be able to sync ratings and post results, your users need to connect via OAuth and authorize access to read & write their data on UTR Sports.

So you can sync ratings for anyone on the platform, as long as they have connected their account and granted your application access.

settings.text:
Event Scheduling and Registration

  • Every player must register for the Event, including paying entry fees if appropriate, on the UTR platform.
  • There must be a minimum of 4 players registered for the Event.
  • Each Event should have a clear start and end date and cannot last longer than two weeks. Creating an Event on the UTR platform with elongated or continuously extended end dates for the purpose of reporting results from a singular event with multiple weeks or multiple separate events is not allowed. Once registration has opened, the event end date cannot be extended by more than a week.
  • The Event must have at least one on-site Organizer. The UTR Event Organizer(s) can play in their own Event(s) but cannot simultaneously act as the designated Event Official in a division he/she is participating in for the duration of the event. It is recommended that there be one Official (Umpire, Organizer, Community Volunteer, etc.) for every four courts of play.
  • Event organizers must include the officiating standards in the event description prior to the close of registration.
  • Registration close must be at least 48 hours before the event starts. Organizers can allow late registrations at their discretion until the Event starts.

Scoring and Reporting Results

  • Reporting of scores must be verified and accurate. UTR actively monitors all Verified events for fraudulent results, including soliciting feedback from everyone who participated in the event.
  • An Event Organizer must be designated who is responsible and accountable for all scores reported and submitted. The Event Organizer cannot be an umpire for any division in which family members are registered.
  • Results must be submitted within 48 hours of the event end date. Corrections to previously submitted scores may be submitted after this period.
  • If additional matches are arranged after players have been formally eliminated from an event (such as happens often in fall intercollegiate or interscholastic tournaments) these matches may also be submitted in the same event to receive UTR credit. Score posting for matches that are not part of the event is not permitted.
  • Organizers must report withdrawals for scheduled matches, regardless of the reason for the withdrawal.
  • Organizers must report retirements from matches in progress with the accurate score at the time of the retirement.
  • Results must reflect actual scores of games and sets from playing on court. Scores cannot be used and changed as an incentive or punishment for certain behaviors (e.g. withdrawals).

Pickleball Scoring Specifics

  • Scoring formats for singles and doubles will follow USAP sanctioning requirements. This is found in section 12 of the USAP Official Rulebook.
  • 12.B.Tournament Scoring Options. The recommended tournament scoring option is best two of three games to 11 points, win by two points. Other options include: best three of five games to 11 points, one game to 15 or one game to 21. All formats win by two points. 
  • Round robin brackets may also use one game to 11, win by two points, if the bracket has six or more teams. 

Tennis Scoring Specifics

  • Score format for singles must be best 2 out of 3 regular sets or 2 out of 3 FAST4 sets (FAST4-Tennis-Information-Sheet)
  • Scoring for FAST4 must be based on actual games won. If the set reaches 3-3, a 7-point tiebreaker will be used to decide the set, and the score will be reported as 4-3.
  • Score format for doubles must be best 2 out of 3 sets, an 8 game pro-set or a regular set. Third set super tiebreak and no-ad scoring is allowed.
  • Score format for high school matches, if different from the above, can be the official scoring format of official high school matches.
  • Australian providers only: Timed matches must last for at least 30 minutes, and one of the players must reach 4 games. On the occasion of an unfinished match, players must resume play until someone reaches the four-game minimum.
  • Incorporating no-ad scoring and no sitting on changeovers is recommended in order to ensure one of the players reaches 4 games in the allotted time.
